failed_criteria: It may also lie horizontally on a shelf or rack—or even on boxes, a ledge, or other surface—as long as it looks reasonably steady and is not likely to fall.
It must not rest against or lean on electrical panels, wiring bundles, meter boxes, or other hazardous equipment.
The ladder setup should look intentional and safe—no loose tools or debris under it, and no obvious risk of falling or sliding.
action_plan: Reposition the ladder horizontally onto a stable surface like a shelf, rack, or solid support rather than chairs to ensure it appears reasonably steady.
Move the ladder away from all electrical panels, wiring bundles, meter boxes, or other hazardous equipment to prevent contact or leaning.
Store the ladder securely so it is intentional and stable, eliminating any risk of it slipping or falling.
visual_feedback: The ladder is draped across chairs under its midpoint, which are not a stable support surface.
The ladder rests directly against electrical panels mounted beneath it, creating a contact hazard.
The overall setup appears precarious, with risk of slipping off the chairs and falling.
